content: Do humans swallow an average of eight spiders per year while sleeping?

I've heard that urban legend before, but it's not true. Spiders don't intentionally seek out human mouths to crawl into while we're sleeping. In reality, spiders are more likely to avoid humans and would probably be disturbed by the presence of a sleeping person. So, no, humans do not swallow eight spiders per year on average. It's just a myth.
